title: DuetGen: Music Driven Two-Person Dance Generation via Hierarchical Masked Modeling
author: Anindita Ghosh (DFKI), Bing Zhou (Snap Inc.), Rishabh Dabral (MPI for Informatics), Jian Wang (Snap Inc.), Vladislav Golyanik (MPI for Informatics), Christian Theobalt (MPI for Informatics), Philipp Slusallek (DFKI), Chuan Guo (Snap Inc.), ...
relevance_why: The methods outlined for generating interactive two-person dances could inform similar approaches in audio-visual integration in my work on audio generation and manipulation, particularly in understanding how body motion relates to music.
background: This research presents a method for generating synchronized two-person dance motions from music input, addressing the complex interactions between dancers and the need for coordination while maintaining musical alignment.
contribution: DuetGen introduces a hierarchical VQ-VAE for encoding two-person dance motions into discrete tokens, solving the challenge of synchronized motion generation, achieving improved dance realism and music alignment.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods largely focused on either single-person motions or reactive partner movements, providing limited interactivity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work advances the state-of-the-art by simultaneously generating coordinated movements for both dancers while leveraging a hierarchical tokenization strategy.

key_innovation: The dual-stage transformer architecture combines music conditioning with a hierarchical modeling approach for dance choreography, enabling enhanced realism and interactivity in motion synthesis.
real_world_impact: This method has significant implications for applications in entertainment, virtual social interactions, and educational environments, where synchronized performances can enhance user engagement.
limitations: The framework does not account for body shape variations and is limited by the available dataset's quality and size.

new_terms.VQ-VAE: **Vector Quantized Variational Autoencoder** is a type of generative model that allows the encoding of input data into discrete latent variables for improved representation and synthesis.
new_terms.hierarchical modeling: **Hierarchical modeling** is a structured approach that separates complex data into different levels of abstraction, facilitating better learning and generation processes.

open_sourcing: Code and model weights are available at https://github.com/anindita127/DuetGen.
